head.title: Treasury Bills Set For This Week

hedline.hl1: Treasury Bills Set For This Week
hedline.hl2: Treasury Bills Set for This Week

block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financing this week includes today's regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills tomorrow.
At the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 3.24 percent.
The Treasury's schedule of financing this week includes today's regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills tomorrow.
The Treasury's schedule of financing this week includes today's regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills tomorrow.
At the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 3.24 percent.
The rate on the six-month issue was 3.46 percent, and the rate on the four-week issue was 3.02 percent.
The following tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
TAX EXEMPT TOMORROW
Knoxville, Tenn., Waste and Water, $140 million of revenue bonds. Competitive.
WEDNESDAY
Maryland, $430 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
TAX EXEMPT ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Alaska Student Loan Corporation, $58.3 million of education loan revenue bonds. RBC Dain Rauscher.
Berkeley County, S.C., Water and Sewer System, $140.4 million of revenue bonds. Banc of America Securities.
California Health Facility Finance Authority, $522.3 million of debt securities for Cedars-Sinai Medical Center. UBS.
Clark County, Nev., $114.7 million of general obligation transportation refunding bonds. UBS.
Community Redevelopment Agency of the City of Los Angeles, $99.8 million of lease revenue bonds for Vermont-Manchester Social Services Project.
Contra Costa County, Calif., Fire Protection District, $130 million of district's taxable pension obligation bonds. Lehman Brothers.
Denver Public Facilities Lease, $60 million of trust certificates of participation.
Detroit, $470 million of city school district refunding bonds. Siebert Brandford Shank.
Flagler County, Fla., School District, $77 million of certificate of participation. Citigroup Global Markets.
Forest Hills Public Schools, Kent County, Mich., $105.2 million of debt securities. A.G. Edwards.
Honolulu Wastewater, $150 million of debt securities. Citigroup Global Markets.
Houston Independent School District, $270 million of debt securities. Lehman Brothers.
Kansas Development Finance Authority, $100 million of debt securities. Citigroup Global Markets.
La Joya, Tex., Independent School District, $75 million of debt securities. Raymond James.
Lee Memorial Health System, Fort Myers, Fla., $63 million of 1997A advance refunding bonds. Goldman Sachs.
Massachusetts Health and Educational Facilities Authority, $50 million of debt securities for Berkshire Health Systems. Cain Brothers.
McAllen, Tex., Independent School District, $120 million of school building bonds. UBS.
Missouri Housing Development Commission, $68 million of single family mortgage revenue bonds for the homeownership program 2005 series. A.G. Edwards.
New York State Thruway Authority, $3 billion of debt securities for second general highway and bridge trust fund restructuring program. Goldman Sachs.
North City West School Facilities Financing Authority, $80 million of subordinate special tax revenue bonds. Morgan Stanley.
Ohio State University, $277 million of general receipts bonds. Lehman Brothers.
Rhode Island Housing and Mortgage Finance Corporation, $114.8 million of homeownership opportunity bonds. Goldman Sachs.
South Dakota Housing, $60 million of debt securities. Citigroup Global Markets.
